t: Job 14
“Man*pn who*i is*i born of woman Is*ld of few days and full of trouble.
He*ld comes forth like a flower and fades away; He*ld flees like a shadow and does not continue.
And*ld do You open Your eyes on such a one, And*ld bring me to judgment with Yourself?
Who*ld can bring a clean thing*i out of an unclean? No*ld one!
Since*ld his days are*i determined, The*ld number of his months is*i with You; You*ld have appointed his limits, so that he cannot pass.
Look*ld away from him that he may rest, Till*ld like a hired man he finishes his day.
“For*ln there is hope for a tree, If*ld it is cut down, that it will sprout again, And*ld that its tender shoots will not cease.
Though*ld its root may grow old in the earth, And*ld its stump may die in the ground,
Yet*ild at the scent of water it will bud And*ld bring forth branches like a plant.
But*ld man dies and is laid away; Indeed*ld he breathes his last And*ld where is*i he?
As*ild water disappears from the sea, And*ld a river becomes parched and dries up,
So*ld man lies down and does not rise. Till*ld the heavens are*i no more, They*ld will not awake Nor*ld be roused from their sleep.
“Oh,*ln that You would hide me in the grave, That*ld You would conceal me until Your wrath is past, That*ld You would appoint me a set time, and remember me!
If*ld a man dies, shall he live again?*i All*ld the days of my hard service I will wait, Till*ld my change comes.
You*ld shall call, and I will answer You; You*ld shall desire the work of Your hands.
For*ld now You number my steps, But*ld do not watch over my sin.
My*ld transgression is*i sealed up in a bag, And*ld You cover my iniquity.
“But*ln as*i a mountain falls and*i crumbles away, And*ld as*i a rock is moved from its place;
As*ild water wears away stones, And*ild as*i torrents wash away the soil of the earth; So*ld You destroy the hope of man.
You*ld prevail forever against him, and he passes on; You*ld change his countenance and send him away.
His*ld sons come to honor, and he does not know it;*i They*ld are brought low, and he does not perceive it.*i
But*ld his flesh will be in pain over it, And*ld his soul will mourn over it.”
